content.question: Which of the following is true of the cross-price elasticity of demand?

choices.label: It can indicate if a good is a necessity or a luxury.
It is greater than zero for two goods that are substitutes.
It is close to zero if the two goods are closely related.
It is always negative because demand curves are downward sloping.

content.answer: It is greater than zero for two goods that are substitutes.
